name: Joseph Priestley
known_for: Discovery of Oxygen (O 2 ) and 9 other gases (including Carbon monoxide (CO), Nitric oxide (NO), Nitrous oxide (NO 2 ), Ammonia (NH 3 ), Sulphur dioxide (SO 2 ), and Nitrogen peroxide (N 2 O 4 ))
notable_works: ''Essay on a Course of Liberal Education for Civil and Active Life'' (1765)
''The History and Present State of Electricity'' (1767)
''Essay on the First Principles of Government'' (1768)
''Experiments and Observations on Different Kinds of Air'' (1774–77)
''An History of the Corruptions of Christianity'' (1782)
children: 5 (Joseph Priestley; William M. Priestley; Sarah Priestley; Joseph Michael Rainsford Priestley; and Henry (Harry) Priestley)<ref name
awards: Fellow of the Royal Society (1766)<ref name
